files.patch:
@@ -49,1 +49,1 @@ - * If the failure is found in an update train of the JDK (e.g. 11.0.x), if possible please see if it's also present in [mainline](https://github.com/openjdk/jdk). See [Indicating what releases an issue is applicable to](#indicating-what-releases-an-issue-is-applicable-to) for more details + * If the failure is found in an update train of the JDK (e.g. 11.0.x), if possible please see if it's also present in [mainline](https://github.com/openjdk/jdk). See [Indicating what releases an issue is applicable to](#indicating-what-releases-an-issue-is-applicable-to) for more details. @@ -81,1 +81,1 @@ -1) If an issue applicable to a feature release N it is assumed to be applicable to all (more recent) releases unless indicated otherwise (see (Rel)-na below). +1) If an issue applicable to a feature release N it is assumed to be applicable to all (more recent) releases unless indicated otherwise (see [(Rel)-na](#usage-of-rel-na-label) below). @@ -92,1 +92,1 @@ -* Do not add additional release values to [Affects Version/s]{.jbs-field} for the same release family. E.g. If there is the value [11.0.2]{.jbs-value}, don't add [11.0.5]{.jbs-value}, [11.0.7]{.jbs-value} etc. Adding an additional value for a separate release family where it's still reproducible, e.g. JDK [21]{.jbs-value}, is encouraged, especially if there is not currently a feature release value set, or, it has been a few releases since it was last reproduced/reviewed. E.g. [Affects Version/s]{.jbs-field} is JDK [8]{.jbs-value} but it is still relevant to the latest mainline release. +* Do not add additional release values to [Affects Version/s]{.jbs-field} for the same release family. For example, if there is the value [11.0.2]{.jbs-value}, don't add [11.0.5]{.jbs-value}, [11.0.7]{.jbs-value} etc. Adding an additional value for a separate release family where it's still reproducible, e.g. JDK [21]{.jbs-value}, is encouraged, especially if there is not currently a feature release value set, or, it has been a few releases since it was last reproduced/reviewed. For example if the [Affects Version/s]{.jbs-field} is JDK [8]{.jbs-value}, but it is still relevant to the latest mainline release. @@ -98,1 +98,1 @@ -[Affects Version]{.jbs-field}: `7u111, 8u131` +[Affects Version]{.jbs-field}: [7u111]{.jbs-value}, [8u131]{.jbs-value} @@ -105,2 +105,2 @@ -- use the label to indicate that a bug is not relevant to an earlier release, for example
[Affects Version]{.jbs-field}: `11.0.20, 17`
the label [8-na]{.jbs-label} would not be needed - as it doesn't have a JDK 8 release, or earlier, value in the [Affects Versions]{.jbs-field}, it is not relevant to JDK 8. -- add multiple `-na` labels: you only need one, for example `9-na, 10-na` is not needed as [9-na]{.jbs-label} implies any following releases. +- use the label to indicate that a bug is not relevant to an earlier release, for example
[Affects Version]{.jbs-field}: [11.0.20]{.jbs-value}, [17]{.jbs-value}
the label [8-na]{.jbs-label} would not be needed - as it doesn't have a JDK 8 release, or earlier, value in the [Affects Versions]{.jbs-field}, it is not relevant to JDK 8. +- add multiple [-na]{.jbs-label} labels: you only need one, for example [9-na]{.jbs-label}, [10-na]{.jbs-label} is not needed, as [9-na]{.jbs-label} implies any following releases. @@ -112,2 +112,1 @@ -Add a comment when adding a (Rel)-wnf label so that it is clear for those looking at the issue, why it won't be fixed -in that release. +Add a comment when adding a [(Rel)-wnf]{.jbs-label} label so that it is clear for those looking at the issue, why it won't be fixed in that release. @@ -212,1 +211,1 @@ - * See [Indicating what releases an issue is applicable to](#indicating-what-releases-an-issue-is-applicable-to) for more details + * See [Indicating what releases an issue is applicable to](#indicating-what-releases-an-issue-is-applicable-to) for more details.
